results.title: Cyborg Chicken
results.brief_description:
In the hen-house, the story of the brave ‘Cyborg Chicken’ is passed down from the Old Master Rooster to the next generation. A story about difference, courage and saving the future, ending with a call to “STOP Global Warming!”.
Voice acting: Anthony Baptiste, Marcus Marshall, Kelsey Noel.
Production design: Kelsey Noel.
Character design: Dominic Ross

results.title: Polybius
results.creator_credit: Joanne Daly, James Houston, Bold Yin and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A SEGA Mega Drive, Commodore 64, floppy disk drives and hard drives sing in unison. The unusual ensemble (controlled live via MIDI) is given a last curtain call in a nostalgic farewell to forgotten friends.

results.title: Here to Fall
results.creator_credit: Jim Agnew, Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board
results.brief_description: A girl falls through darkness. A signal is broadcast, it’s a call. City wires connect and vibrate. The digital signal holds her, dropping her to a city’s rooftops that builds around her. She recognises it, and she’s safe, but for how long?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jim Agnew, Kris Kelly, Evelyn McGrath, Blacknorth, Arts Council (Ireland) and Irish Film Board

results.title: Abuelas
results.creator_credit: Katherine Lee, Afarin Eghbal, Kasia Malipan and National Film and Television School (Great Britain)
results.brief_description:
Between 1976 and 1983 Argentina was under a military regime that launched a campaign of terror (now known as the ‘Dirty War’) in which 30,000 people ‘disappeared’.
Among them were children and pregnant women. An estimated 500 babies were born in concentration camps. Whilst the mothers were killed, the children were adopted out, in many cases to military families.
For over 30 years, the ‘Las Abuelas de Plaza de la Mayo’ (‘Grandmothers of the Plaza de Mayo’) have been campaigning to recover these lost grandchildren. Since 2011 over 100 have been found and regained their true identities.
The Abuelas continue to search for the rest.

results.title: Only Sound Remains
results.creator_credit: Aliocha Allard, Pierre-Alain Giraud, Arash Ashtiani, Anshu Poddar and London Film School
results.brief_description: In the wake of the violent post-election protests in Iran, a man and his wife, Babak and Nahid, try to hide the devastating news from Babak’s grandmother that his brother is missing.

results.title: Olympic Legacy: this was forever
results.creator_credit: Mark Aitken, Polkadotsonraindrops and First Light
results.brief_description: Set in East London, the location of the 2012 Olympics, this documentary follows a community’s battle to prevent their allotments being swallowed up in the development plans. This powerful film looks at what happens when a diverse group of people are united in despair about the effects of change.

results.title: Beautiful lies: a film about Peter Carey
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Australian Film Commission and Australia Council
results.brief_description: Peter Carey is one of Australia’s most talented writers. All four of his published works have won major literary awards. This film, takes a journey through his life and work and looks at the way he transforms his native country into a bizarre land of nightmares and surreal comedy. Throughout the film, an interview with Peter Carey is interwoven with lavish dramatisation. An intriguing and illuminating film about a remarkable writer.

results.title: Moon to Dust
results.creator_credit: Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT and Kanlaya Padungsin
results.brief_description: Winner of ‘Best Character Animation’ for RMIT’s AIM Graduate Screenings, 2009. Set to the song of the same name by Georgia Fields, ‘Moon to Dust’ is a beautiful and melancholic rendering of belonging, isolation and change.
